page.title: 02THE VILLAGE
page.content: Llanfairwaterdine Church rebuilt 1854 has an average congregation of 30 over a year. The local inn which is residential is 17th Century and is a popular eating place. The Post Office and shop is probably the oldest building in the village. Everest Hall, originally the School, built in the 1800, so called due to the connection with Lord Hunt leader of the Everest Expedition, is used for social functions - Women's Institute Mother's Union Mixed Choir, Darts and Dominoes Competitions, Parish Council Meetings and Parochial Church Council and the Everst Hall Committee which runs the Hall. Dances. Whist Drives, Wedding receptions etc.
